title: Finite character
summary: In mathematics, a family F {\displaystyle {\mathcal {F}}} of sets is of finite character if for each A {\displaystyle A} , A {\displaystyle A} belongs to F {\displaystyle {\mathcal {F}}} if and only if every finite subset of A {\displaystyle A} belongs to F {\displaystyle {\mathcal {F}}} .
